citation.article-title: Leminorella, a new genus of Enterobacteriaceae: identification of Leminorella grimontii sp. nov. and Leminorella richardii sp. nov. found in clinical specimens.

p.s: Description of Leminorella grimontii sp. nov.

Leminorella grimontii (pronounced gree-mohn'-tee-eye. This species name is derived from the surname of Patrick Grimont, a French microbiologist at the Pasteur Institute, and for his wife and colleague, Francine Grimont. They have done definitive work on the genus Serratia, described new species of Enterobacteriaceae, and studied enteric bacteria phenetically and genetically (6-9). The species name is treated as a modern Latin genitive noun meaning "of Grimont.")
The name L. grimontii is proposed for the first DNA hybridization group and is proposed as the type species for the genus.
The type strain for this species is designated as CDC 1944-81 (ATCC 33999).
